newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hokkaido Electric to buy power from Nippon Steel.
newsitem.headline: Hokkaido Electric to buy power from Nippon Steel.

text.p: Hokkaido Electric Power Co Inc said on Monday it will buy 100,000 kilowatts (kw) of electricity from Nippon Steel Corp's Muroran Works for 15 years starting in October 2001.
Following the deregulation of Japan's electricity industry in December 1995, Hokkaido Electric floated its first-ever tender last year to buy electricity from independent power producers.

The electric utility, serving about 2.32 million households on Japan's northern major island of Hokkaido, is planning to hold a tender again this year to buy another 100,000 kw of electricity for 15 years from 2004, a company spokesman said.
